sections.title: Role Context & Daily Workflows
sections.goal: Understand the interviewee’s day-to-day responsibilities in relation to the Phoenix Feature Store and how they interact with other teams.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through a typical day working on Phoenix Feature Store?
Which other departments do you collaborate with most frequently, and how?
How does your MLOps work connect to the UX or data consumption side?

sections.title: Feature Store Architecture & User Flows
sections.goal: Explore how the architecture supports both online and offline serving and the implications for end-user experience.
sample_questions: Can you describe the main components of the Phoenix Feature Store architecture?
How do you manage consistency between online and offline feature data?
What are the key pain points for data scientists or analysts using the store?

sections.title: Model CI/CD & Deployment Experience
sections.goal: Investigate the tooling and processes for deploying models that consume features from the store.
sample_questions: What does the CI/CD pipeline look like for models depending on Phoenix?
How do you validate feature availability and correctness before deployment?
Can you share an example of a deployment that went particularly well or poorly?

sections.title: Drift Monitoring & Incident Response
sections.goal: Understand how drift is detected, reported, and mitigated in the Phoenix Feature Store context.
sample_questions: What types of drift do you monitor for and how are alerts configured?
How do you prioritize and respond to drift-related incidents?
Can you recall a recent drift incident and the steps taken to resolve it?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Uncover dependencies and integration patterns between Phoenix and other portfolio projects or external systems.
sample_questions: Does Phoenix integrate with the Helios Datalake or Mercury Messaging, and if so, how?
What challenges have you faced in cross-project data consistency or latency?
Are there shared runbooks or RFCs that guide these integrations?

sections.title: Future Improvements & Risks
sections.goal: Discuss planned enhancements, potential risks, and trade-offs in design or process.
sample_questions: What upcoming changes are planned for Phoenix to improve user experience?
Are there any technical debts or architectural risks you’re concerned about?
How do you balance rapid iteration with stability and compliance?
